Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Europa on the Bull. The wide rounded shoulder is decorated with plant tendrils in relief. On top of the nozzle is an indistinct mask. On each side is an ornamental lug. Within the pseudo-base-ring is an impressed branch pattern. The discus is broken; the lamp probably had a plastic handle, now missing. Traces of an orange slip remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2081)
